title: Alternative definition of the value of an operation

blocks.name: aoveq123d
blocks.content: Equality deduction for operation value, analogous to ~ oveq123d . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: nfaov
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for operation value, analogous to ~ nfov . To prove a deduction version of this analogous to ~ nfovd is not quickly possible because many deduction versions for bound-variable hypothesis builder for constructs the definition of alternative operation values is based on are not available (see ~ nfafv ). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: csbaovg
blocks.content: Move class substitution in and out of an operation. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm csbaovg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(csb(s0, c0, caov(c2, c3, c4)), caov(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3), csb(s0, c0, c4))))
} = {
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, c1, wceq(csb(s0, c0, caov(c2, c3, c4)), caov(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3), csb(s0, c0, c4))), wceq(csb(s0, cv(hs0), caov(c2, c3, c4)), caov(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c4))))
  eqeq12d(csb(s0, cv(hs0), caov(c2, c3, c4)), caov(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c4)), csb(s0, c0, caov(c2, c3, c4)), caov(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3), csb(s0, c0, c4)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, caov(c2, c3, c4))
  aoveq123d(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c4), csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3), csb(s0, c0, c4), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c3)
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c4)
  csbief(s0, cv(hs0), caov(c2, c3, c4), caov(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c4)))
  vex(hs0)
  nfaov(s0, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c4))

  nfcsb1v(s0, cv(hs0), c3)
  nfcsb1v(s0, cv(hs0), c4)
  aoveq123d(c2, c3, c4, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c4), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c3)
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(csb(s0, c0, caov(c2, c3, c4)), caov(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3), csb(s0, c0, c4))))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm csbaovg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  eqeq12d([hs0 / s0]((c2 c3 c4)), (([hs0 / s0]c2[hs0 / s0]c3[hs0 / s0]c4)), [c0 / s0]((c2 c3 c4)), (([c0 / s0]c2[c0 / s0]c3[c0 / s0]c4)), hs0 = c0)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, ((c2 c3 c4)))
  aoveq123d([hs0 / s0]c2, [hs0 / s0]c3, [hs0 / s0]c4, [c0 / s0]c2, [c0 / s0]c3, [c0 / s0]c4, hs0 = c0)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, c3)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, c2)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, c4)
  csbief(s0, hs0, ((c2 c3 c4)), (([hs0 / s0]c2[hs0 / s0]c3[hs0 / s0]c4)))
  vex(hs0)
  nfaov(s0, [hs0 / s0]c2, [hs0 / s0]c3, [hs0 / s0]c4)

  nfcsb1v(s0, hs0, c3)
  nfcsb1v(s0, hs0, c4)

blocks.name: aovfundmoveq
blocks.content: If a class is a function restricted to an ordered pair of its domain, then the value of the operation on this pair is equal for both definitions. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovnfundmuv
blocks.content: If an ordered pair is not in the domain of a class or the class is not a function restricted to the ordered pair, then the operation value for this pair is the universal class. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: ndmaov
blocks.content: The value of an operation outside its domain, analogous to ~ ndmafv . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: ndmaovg
blocks.content: The value of an operation outside its domain, analogous to ~ ndmovg . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovvdm
blocks.content: If the operation value of a class for an ordered pair is a set, the ordered pair is contained in the domain of the class. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: nfunsnaov
blocks.content: If the restriction of a class to a singleton is not a function, its operation value is the universal class. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovvfunressn
blocks.content: If the operation value of a class for an argument is a set, the class restricted to the singleton of the argument is a function. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovprc
blocks.content: The value of an operation when the one of the arguments is a proper class, analogous to ~ ovprc . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovrcl
blocks.content: Reverse closure for an operation value, analogous to ~ afvvv . In contrast to ~ ovrcl , elementhood of the operation's value in a set is required, not containing an element. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovpcov0
blocks.content: If the alternative value of the operation on an ordered pair is the universal class, the operation's value at this ordered pair is the empty set. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovnuoveq
blocks.content: The alternative value of the operation on an ordered pair equals the operation's value at this ordered pair. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovvoveq
blocks.content: The alternative value of the operation on an ordered pair equals the operation's value on this ordered pair. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aov0ov0
blocks.content: If the alternative value of the operation on an ordered pair is the empty set, the operation's value at this ordered pair is the empty set. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovovn0oveq
blocks.content: If the operation's value at an argument is not the empty set, it equals the value of the alternative operation at this argument. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aov0nbovbi
blocks.content: The operation's value on an ordered pair is an element of a set if and only if the alternative value of the operation on this ordered pair is an element of that set, if the set does not contain the empty set. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: aovov0bi
blocks.content: The operation's value on an ordered pair is the empty set if and only if the alternative value of the operation on this ordered pair is either the empty set or the universal class. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm aovov0bi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), emptycls), wo(wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), emptycls), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe)))
} = {
  3bitri(wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), emptycls), wo(wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), emptycls), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe)), wceq(cfv(c1, cop(c0, c2)), emptycls), wo(wceq(cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)), emptycls), wceq(cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)), universe)))
  eqeq1i(co(c0, c1, c2), emptycls, cfv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))
  df-ov(c0, c1, c2)
  afvfv0bi(c1, cop(c0, c2))
  orbi12i(wceq(cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)), emptycls), wceq(cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)), universe), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), emptycls), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe))
  bicomi(wceq(cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)), emptycls), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), emptycls))
  eqeq1i(caov(c0, c1, c2), emptycls, cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))
  bicomi(wceq(cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)), universe), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe))
  eqeq1i(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe, cafv(c1, cop(c0, c2)))
  df-aov(c0, c1, c2)
}

thm aovov0bi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

blocks.name: rspceaov
blocks.content: A frequently used special case of ~ rspc2ev for operation values, analogous to ~ rspceov . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm rspceaov(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(c4, caov(c0, c5, c2))), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c3, wceq(c4, caov(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
} = {
  rspc2ev(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, wceq(c4, caov(c0, c5, c2)), wceq(c4, caov(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1))), wceq(c4, caov(c0, c5, cv(s1))))
  eqeq2d(c4, caov(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1)), caov(c0, c5, cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  aoveq123d(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1), c0, c5, cv(s1), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  eqidd(c5, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  id(wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  eqidd(cv(s1), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  eqeq2d(c4, caov(c0, c5, cv(s1)), caov(c0, c5, c2), wceq(cv(s1), c2))
  aoveq123d(c0, c5, cv(s1), c0, c5, c2, wceq(cv(s1), c2))
  eqidd(c5, wceq(cv(s1), c2))
  eqidd(c0, wceq(cv(s1), c2))
  id(wceq(cv(s1), c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c4, caov(c0, c5, cv(s1)))
  diff.caov.s(s0, c0, c5, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, c4, caov(c0, c5, c2))
  diff.caov.s(s1, c0, c5, c2)
}

thm rspceaov(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  aoveq123d(s0, c5, s1, c0, c5, s1, s0 = c0)
  eqidd(c5, s0 = c0)

blocks.name: fnotaovb
blocks.content: Equivalence of operation value and ordered triple membership, analogous to ~ fnopfvb . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

blocks.name: ffnaov
blocks.content: An operation maps to a class to which all values belong, analogous to ~ ffnov . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm ffnaov(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wb(wf(c0, cxp(c1, c2), c3), wa(wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c2)), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c2, wcel(caov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), c3)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  bitri(wf(c0, cxp(c1, c2), c3), wa(wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c2)), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c2, wcel(caov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), c3)))), wa(wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c2)), wral(hs0, cxp(c1, c2), wcel(cafv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3))))
  ffnafv(hs0, c0, cxp(c1, c2), c3)
  anbi2i(wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c2)), wral(hs0, cxp(c1, c2), wcel(cafv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3)), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c2, wcel(caov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), c3))))
  ralxp(hs0, s0, s1, c1, c2, wcel(cafv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3), wcel(caov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), c3))
  eleq1d(cafv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, caov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  syl6eqr(cafv(c0, cv(hs0)), caov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), cafv(c0, cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  afveq2(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0)
  df-aov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cxp(c1, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(caov(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), c3))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cafv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3)
  diff.cafv.s(s0, c0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cafv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3)
  diff.cafv.s(s1, c0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

  syl6eqr((c0 ''' hs0), ((s0 c0 s1)), (c0 ''' < s0, s1 >), hs0 = < s0, s1 >)

  diff.hs0.c((c1 √ó c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)

}

blocks.name: faovcl
blocks.content: Closure law for an operation, analogous to ~ fovcl . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm faovcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(caov(c0, c4, c2), c5))
  -| wf(c4, cxp(c1, c3), c5)
} = {
  mpi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(caov(c0, c4, c2), c5), wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c3, wcel(caov(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), c5))))
  ax-mp(wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c3, wcel(caov(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), c5))), wf(c4, cxp(c1, c3), c5))

} = {

  sylancl(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(caov(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1))), wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cdm(c4)), wfun(cres(c4, csn(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  3impa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cdm(c4)))
  impcom(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cdm(c4)))
  syl(wcel(c2, c3), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cdm(c4))), wceq(cdm(c4), cxp(c0, c1)))
  dmmpt2g(s0, s1, c2, c3, c4, c0, c1)
  syl5ibr(wceq(cdm(c4), cxp(c0, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cdm(c4)), wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cxp(c0, c1)))
  opelxpi(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1), c1)
  eleq2(cdm(c4), cxp(c0, c1), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  ax-mp(wfun(cres(c4, csn(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wfun(c4))

  funres(c4, csn(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))))

  df-dfat(c4, cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  aovfundmoveq(c4, cv(s0), cv(s1))

blocks.name: ndmaovcl
blocks.content: The "closure" of an operation outside its domain, when the operation's value is a set in contrast to ~ ndmovcl where it is required that the domain contains the empty set ( ` (/) e. S ` ). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)

thm ndmaovcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3)
  -| wceq(cdm(c1), cxp(c3, c3))
  -| wi(wa(wcel(c0, c3), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3))
  -| wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe)
} = {
  pm2.61i(wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3), wa(wcel(c0, c3), wcel(c2, c3)))
  sylnbir(wa(wcel(c0, c3), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3), wcel(cop(c0, c2), cxp(c3, c3)))
  opelxp(c0, c2, c3, c3)
  sylnbi(wcel(cop(c0, c2), cxp(c3, c3)), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3), wcel(cop(c0, c2), cdm(c1)))
  eleq2i(cop(c0, c2), cxp(c3, c3), cdm(c1))
  eqcomi(cxp(c3, c3), cdm(c1))
  mpsyl(wn(wcel(cop(c0, c2), cdm(c1))), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe))
  ndmaov(c0, c2, c1)
  syl6com(wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe), wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3), wcel(universe, universe))
  biimpd(wceq(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe), wcel(universe, universe))
  eleq1(caov(c0, c1, c2), universe, universe)
  pm2.21i(wcel(universe, universe), wcel(caov(c0, c1, c2), c3))
  vprc()
}

  ndmaov(c0, c2, c1)

thm ndmaovcom(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wn(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1))), wceq(caov(c0, c3, c2), caov(c2, c3, c0)))

  bitr3i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wcel(cop(c0, c2), cdm(c3)), wcel(cop(c0, c2), cxp(c1, c1)))
  opelxp(c0, c2, c1, c1)

  sylnbi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(caov(c2, c3, c0), universe), wcel(cop(c2, c0), cdm(c3)))
  3bitr2i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wcel(cop(c2, c0), cdm(c3)), wa(wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(cop(c2, c0), cxp(c1, c1)))
  ancom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1))
  opelxp(c2, c0, c1, c1)
  eleq2i(cop(c2, c0), cxp(c1, c1), cdm(c3))
  eqcomi(cxp(c1, c1), cdm(c3))

}

thm ndmaovass(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wn(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1))), wceq(caov(caov(c0, c4, c2), c4, c3), caov(c0, c4, caov(c2, c4, c3))))

blocks.content: Any operation is distributive outside its domain. In contrast to ~ ndmovdistr where it is required that the operation's domain doesn't contain the empty set ( ` -. (/) e. S ` ), no additional assumption is required. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
